properties.Name: New Brighton
properties.Description: New Brighton is part of a vast stretch of straight, sandy coastline popular for a range of activities including swimming, surfing, kite surfing, fishing and walking. Central New Brighton offers all amenities including the impressive 300m-long pier.

properties.Name: Southshore Spit
properties.Description: Southshore Spit Reserve is a great example of a dynamic landscape feature and important wildlife habitat. Popular for birdwatching, visitors can enjoy a 40 minute loop walk around the spit starting at Rockinghorse Rd. Safe swimming is nearby at South Brighton.

properties.Lifeguard patrol: Flagged sections between November and March
properties.Name: Sumner
properties.Description: Having an icecream at Sumner and a walk along the esplanade or a dip in the sea is a big part of being in Christchurch. Sumner Beach is east of Cave Rock and Scarborough Beach, generally more favoured by surfers, to the west. The nearby village offers a full range of amenities.

properties.Name: Taylors Mistake
properties.Description: Tucked away over the hill from Sumner, Taylors Mistake is a great beach experience. Facilities include carparking, picnic areas, playground, toilets and changing rooms.

properties.Name: Magazine Bay
properties.Description: Enjoy the sheltered sandy beach of Magazine Bay before exploring the Torpedo Boat Museum housed in a historic powder magazine. The neighbouring bays of Corsair and Cass are accessible via the scenic Coastal Path.

properties.Name: Cass Bay
properties.Description: A popular swimming beach, Cass Bay has three different coves linked by a gentle walking track and a playground complete with flying fox.

properties.Name: Corsair Bay
properties.Description: Beautiful Corsair Bay in Lyttelton Harbour is a safe swimming beach, popular for kayaking and paddleboarding and for enjoying a stroll along the Coastal Path to neighbouring bays. Facilities include changing rooms, toilets, picnic tables, and a playground. Car parks open from 7am-9pm in summer and 7.30am-5.30pm in winter.

properties.Name: Sandy Bay
properties.Description: Sandy Bay is a lesser known harbourside gem. Perfect for a family day out, this is a safe swimming beach and great for sailing, kayaking, paddleboarding, fishing, coastal walking and cycling. Food is available at the café or historic pub nearby.

properties.Name: Quail Island
properties.Description: Ōtamahua/Quail Island lies in the inner harbour, reached via a short ferry ride from Lyttelton. It's easily explored in a few hours and there are plenty of safe swimming opportunities and sheltered picnic spots.

properties.Name: Diamond Harbour
properties.Description: Park at the Diamond Harbour village centre or get the ferry across from Lyttelton and walk to this stony but nicely sheltered deep water swimming beach. Amenities include toilets at the beach, local cafes and plenty of walking options.

properties.Name: Purau Bay
properties.Description: The shallow, gentle waters at this broad bay are ideal for sailing, kayaking, paddle boarding and safe swimming. With easy access, parking, and a sunny picnic area on the grass, take the family for a great day out. Try the cafes in nearby Diamond Harbour.

properties.Name: Hays Bay
properties.Description: Safe and peaceful swimming beach near Charteris Bay Yacht Club.

properties.Name: Akaroa
properties.Description: The harbourside village of Akaroa on Banks Peninsula is a 90 minute drive from Christchurch. The township has its own safe swimming beach perfect for a quick dip on a warm day and building a few sandcastles. All the amenities you could need are conveniently on hand.

properties.Name: Okains Bay
properties.Description: Okains Bay is just a 25 minute drive from Akaroa. With a sheltered sandy beach and lagoon it's perfect for swimming, kayaking, paddle boarding and fishing - as well as a game of beach cricket with the kids. Come for the weekend and stay in the beachside camping ground. There's a store and museum nearby.

properties.Lifeguard patrol: No lifeguards or flags but the Surf Life Saving Club patrols over summer
properties.Name: Scarborough Beach
properties.Description: Scarborough Beach is popular for surfing with conditions more favourable at the northern end of the beach. Swimming is safest at the southern end, take care because there's no lifeguard patrol but the north end of the beach is home to the Surf Life Saving Club which runs patrols over summer months. Scarborough has a great playground and paddling pool for children as well as a cafe for ice cream and coffee breaks. Be sure to check out the historic Clock Tower while you're there.

properties.Lifeguard patrol: Over summer, lifeguards are on patrol in weekends and during the school holiday weeks
properties.Name: Waimairi Beach
properties.Description: A popular recreational beach, Waimairi is good for swimming and kite surfing. Neighbouring Broad Park offers a playground and grassy picnic areas for when the golden sandy beach gets too hot.
